required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Remifentanil in Children With Obstructive Sleep Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: The Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamics Profiles of Remifentanil in Children With Obstructive Sleep Apnea.

brief_summary.textblock: This investigation tested the hypothesis that children with obstructive sleep apnea have an increased pharmacodynamic sensitivity to the miotic and respiratory depressant effects of the prototypic Î¼-opioid agonist remifentanil.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Parallel group study comparing patients with obstructive sleep apnea undergoing tonsillectomy or tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy to controls with no history of obstructive sleep apnea undergoing general anesthesia for any procedure. The study will be conducted in the patient's preoperative holding area room. Two intravenous catheters will be placed, one for a remifentanil infusion and one for blood draws to measure the blood concentration of remifentanil. Patients will have standard ASA monitors placed with vital signs monitored on a portable monitor, and a remifentanil infusion will be started. Blood draws will be taken at seven time points: zero, one, two, four, six, ten and fifteen minutes. Concomitantly, recordings of end tidal CO2, respiratory rate, and pupil diameter will be made at the seven time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in end-expired carbon dioxide from baseline over time - OSA Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measurements taken at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: End-expired carbon dioxide monitoring using bedside monitoring

primary_outcome.measure: Change in end-expired carbon dioxide from baseline over time - Control (non-OSA) Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measurements taken at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: End-expired carbon dioxide monitoring using bedside monitoring

primary_outcome.measure: Change in respiratory rate from baseline over time - OSA Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measurements taken at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory monitoring was performed using nasal cannula

primary_outcome.measure: Change in respiratory rate from baseline over time - Control (non-OSA) Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measurements taken at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory monitoring was performed using nasal cannula

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pupil diameter from baseline over time - OSA Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measured continuously and averaged into 10-s bins following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: Dark adapted infrared pupillometry performed using binocular infrared pupilometer mounted in light occlusive goggles sampling at 100 Hz.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pupil diameter from baseline over time - Control (non-OSA) Group
primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Measured continuously and averaged into 10-s bins following remefentanil infusion
primary_outcome.description: Dark adapted infrared pupillometry performed using binocular infrared pupilometer mounted in light occlusive goggles sampling at 100 Hz.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Blood draws at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion
Approximately 1 hour before surgery - Blood draws at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 10 & 15 minutes following remefentanil infusion

arm_group.description: a) Children 8-14 years old, b) ASA physical status 1or 2, c) undergoing tonsillectomy or tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy for known obstructive sleep apnea
a) Children 8-14 years old, b) ASA physical status 1or 2, c) no known obstructive sleep apnea presenting for any procedure requiring general anesthetic

intervention.description: 15 minute remifentanil Infusion of either 0.05, 0.1, 0.15 or 0.2 mcg/kg/min

criteria.textblock:
OSA Group:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 8-14 years old
- ASA physical status 1 or 2
- undergoing tonsillectomy or tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy for known obstructive sleep apnea
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to cooperate with study requirements (IV placement, sitting quietly, wearing goggles, etc.)
Control (Non-OSA) Group:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 8-14 years old
- ASA physical status 1 or 2
- no known obstructive sleep apnea presenting for any procedure requiring general anesthtic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to cooperate with study requirements (IV placement, sitting quietly, wearing goggles, etc.)

results_reference.citation: Brown KA. Outcome, risk, and error and the child with obstructive sleep apnea. Paediatr Anaesth. 2011 Jul;21(7):771-80. doi: 10.1111/j.1460-9592.2011.03597.x. Epub 2011 May 3. Review.

Marcus CL, Brooks LJ, Draper KA, Gozal D, Halbower AC, Jones J, Schechter MS, Ward SD, Sheldon SH, Shiffman RN, Lehmann C, Spruyt K; American Academy of Pediatrics. Diagnosis and management of childhood obstructive sleep apnea syndrome. Pediatrics. 2012 Sep;130(3):e714-55. doi: 10.1542/peds.2012-1672. Epub 2012 Aug 27. Review.

Bhattacharyya N, Lin HW. Changes and consistencies in the epidemiology of pediatric adenotonsillar surgery, 1996-2006. Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 2010 Nov;143(5):680-4. doi: 10.1016/j.otohns.2010.06.918.
